alphas.name: Stakeholders
alphas.description: The people, groups, or organizations who affect or are affected by a software system.

states.name: Represented
states.description: The mechanisms for involving the stakeholders are agreed and the stakeholder representatives have been appointed.

states.name: Involved
states.description: The stakeholder representatives are actively involved in the work and fulfilling their responsibilities.

states.name: In Agreement
states.description: The stakeholder representatives are in agreement.

states.name: Satisfied for Deployment
states.description: The minimal expectations of the stakeholder representatives have been achieved.

states.name: Satisfied in Use
states.description: The system has met or exceeds the minimal stakeholder expectations.

checkpoints.name: Stakeholder groups identified
checkpoints.description: All the different groups of stakeholders that are, or will be, affected by the development and operation of the software system are identified.

checkpoints.name: Key stakeholder groups represented
checkpoints.description: There is agreement on the stakeholder groups to be represented. At a minimum, the stakeholders groups that fund, use, support, and maintain the system have been considered.

checkpoints.name: Responsibilities defined
checkpoints.description: The responsibilities of the stakeholder representatives have been defined.

checkpoints.name: Responsibilities agreed
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representatives have agreed to take on their responsibilities.

checkpoints.name: Representatives authorized
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representatives are authorized to carry out their responsibilities.

checkpoints.name: Collaboration approach agreed
checkpoints.description: The collaboration approach among the stakeholder representatives has been agreed.

checkpoints.name: Way of working supported & respected
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representative’s support and respect the team’s way of working.

checkpoints.name: Representatives assist the team
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representatives assist the team in accordance with their responsibilities.

checkpoints.name: Timely feedback and decisions provided
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representatives provide feedback and take part in decision making in a timely manner.

checkpoints.name: Changes promptly communicated
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representatives promptly communicate changes that are relevant for their stakeholder groups.

checkpoints.name: Minimal expectations agreed
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representatives have agreed upon their minimal expectations for the next deployment of the new system.

checkpoints.name: Rep's happy with their involvement
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representatives are happy with their involvement in the work.

checkpoints.name: Rep's input valued
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representatives agree that their input is valued by the team and treated with respect.

checkpoints.name: Team's input valued
checkpoints.description: The team members agree that their input is valued by the stakeholder representatives and treated with respect.

checkpoints.name: Priorities clear & perspectives balanced
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representatives agree with how their different priorities and perspectives are being balanced to provide a clear direction for the team.

checkpoints.name: Stakeholder feedback provided
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representatives provide feedback on the system from their stakeholder group perspective.

checkpoints.name: System ready for deployment
checkpoints.description: The stakeholder representatives confirm that they agree that the system is ready for deployment.

checkpoints.name: Feedback on system use available
checkpoints.description: Stakeholders are using the new system and providing feedback on their experiences.

checkpoints.name: System meets expectations
checkpoints.description: The stakeholders confirm that the new system meets their expectations.
